channel.title: Atcoder on cmplx-xyttmt
channel.description: Recent content in Atcoder on cmplx-xyttmt

item.title: Security 2 (ABC 407 C)
item.description: The Problem At the entrance of AtCoder Inc., there is a special pass-code input device. The device consists of a screen displaying one string, and two buttons. Let tt be the string shown on the screen. Initially, tt is the empty string. Pressing a button changes tt as follows: Pressing button A appends 0 to the end of tt. Pressing button B replaces every digit in tt with the next digit: for digits 0 through 8 the next digit is the one whose value is larger by 1; the next digit after 9 is 0.

item.title: Domino Covering XOR (ABC 407 D)
item.description: In this article, let’s take a look at Problem D: Domino Covering XOR from AtCoder Beginner Contest 407. When I first attempted this problem, I wasn’t able to solve it on my own. My initial approach led me down a rabbit hole: attempting to maximize the XOR by strategically choosing which numbers to exclude, bit by bit, from most significant to least. This quickly proved difficult to implement, as removing a single number (by covering it with a domino) necessarily meant covering an adjacent one as well.
